column4: so does anyone know how I can install something with apt-get when it tells me that some other app has an unmet dependancy ?  and how can I permanently get rid of the warning, when the package it wants is not needed and doesn't exist, heh
this fixes the dependencies: sudo apt-get install -f
this ignores any packages not installed, it's man apt-get: sudo apt-get install -m package-name
thank you, I will give that a try

oops, that last line I said was for you: I tried both "apt-get install -m netpbm" and "apt-get -m install netpbm", but neither tried to install it, it just complained about the opera package not having its non-existant dependancy
it got lost in the flood of chat in here, heh.
try download package libqt3-mt
remove the opera package, and install it again with automatix
I have never heard of automatix, will look it up
look about the warning they all say in !automatix :P
just read that warning, heh
if you're still with 6.06 better forget about automatix, i heard it really is breaking stuff, can you tell me the name of the package you can't find?
nothlit: opera: Depends: xlib6g (>= 3.3.6) but it is not installable or xlibs but it is not installable
try from deb http://deb.opera.com/opera/ stable non-free
he's in console, can't do that
I know, I was explaining how to get back to IRC once their X is started
can you tell me the broken dependency package again?
opera: Depends: xlib6g (>= 3.3.6) but it is not installable or xlibs but it is not installable
and that package is a dummy placeholder package, used to transition to a new package with Xorg 7.x (as far as I remember, when I looked it up before)
have you read this? https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OperaBrowser
libqt3-mt is already the newest version.
are you dapper drake release client RC or long term support LTS?
I installed the official 6.06 version just after it was released, to a clean partition (switched from Arch Linux in June)
